item.title: The SIR model
item.description: Introduction In class we covered the SIR model with births and deaths. Assuming the birth rate is equal to the death rate (\(\mu\)) gives: \[\begin{align*} \frac{dS}{dt} &= \mu N -\beta S I - \mu S\\ \frac{dI}{dt} &= \beta S I - \gamma I - \mu I\\ \frac{dR}{dt} &= \gamma I - \mu R. \end{align*}\] So what do these terms mean? Suppose the unit of time we are considering is days, then
